content:
I am a Senior Undergraduate at Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur majoring in Computer Science and Engineering, broadly interested in the areas of Large Scale Multi Agent Reinforcement Learning, Behavioral Models and Game Theory, Decision Making under Uncertainty, Generative Models.
Currently I am a Research Assistant at CARE.AI Lab at Singapore Management University working with Prof.Arunesh Sinha, Prof. Pradeep Varakantham and Prof. Main Ahn Tien.
Previously I have worked with Prof.Soumendu Sundar Mukherjee (December 2019, May 2020-October 2020) at Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata and with Prof.Piyush Rai at IIT Kanpur (December 2020-March 2021). In my sophomore year, I worked with Prof. Ketan Rajawat at IIT Kanpur.
For recreation purposes, I play guitar and am an avid follower of Formula1.
summary:

Currently I am a Research Assistant at CARE.AI Lab at Singapore Management University working with Prof.Arunesh Sinha, Prof. Pradeep Varakantham and Prof. Main Ahn Tien.
Previously I have worked with Prof.
title: Avinandan Bose

content: Developed a framework to train deep generative models using interpolations modelled by Neural ODEs which simultaneously learns a distribution of trajectories which interpolate smoothly and reversibly between pairs of images ensuring these interpolations have high image quality and are diverse in nature.
summary: Developed a framework to train deep generative models using interpolations modelled by Neural ODEs which simultaneously learns a distribution of trajectories which interpolate smoothly and reversibly between pairs of images ensuring these interpolations have high image quality and are diverse in nature.
title: NeurInt : Learning to Interpolate using Neural ODEs

content: Developed a specialized temporal topic model with provisions for change points, scalable to large corpora of text data. Our model facilitates detection change points, ie.changes in the distribution generating data when the data is textual in nature. We were able to detect accurately well known changepoints in real datasets, like literary eras in English Literature and Trends in High Energy Physics research papers.
summary: Developed a specialized temporal topic model with provisions for change points, scalable to large corpora of text data. Our model facilitates detection change points, ie.changes in the distribution generating data when the data is textual in nature. We were able to detect accurately well known changepoints in real datasets, like literary eras in English Literature and Trends in High Energy Physics research papers.
title: Changepoint Analysis in Topic Proportions in Temporal Text Data

content: Explored Approximate Inference for high volume and multi-way temporal data in Tensor form for Traffic Prediction. I extended pre-existing Tensor Factorization models, to a model obeying first-order auto-regression to capture the temporal dynamics useful for online applications like traffic forecasting and predicting estimated time of arrival for cab services.
summary: Explored Approximate Inference for high volume and multi-way temporal data in Tensor form for Traffic Prediction. I extended pre-existing Tensor Factorization models, to a model obeying first-order auto-regression to capture the temporal dynamics useful for online applications like traffic forecasting and predicting estimated time of arrival for cab services.
title: Traffic Prediction using Variational Bayesian Inference for Tensor Factorisation and Completion
